DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine effectiveness safety corneal collagen cross-linking irradiance level 9 18 mW/cm2 .
DOC.brief_title: Study Safety Effectiveness Collagen Cross-Linking Irradiance 9 mW/cm2 18 mW/cm2
DOC.criteria: General Inclusion Criteria Prospective subject must meet follow criterion eligible participation : 18 year age old Signed write informed consent Willingness ability comply schedule followup visit Contact lens removal prior evaluation treatment Inclusion criterion progressive keratoconus Prospective subject must meet two follow criterion : Having diagnosis progressive keratoconus : An increase ≥ 1.00 D steep keratometry value An increase ≥ 1.00 D astigmatism manifest refraction A myopic shift ( decrease spherical equivalent ) ≥ 0.50 D subjective manifest refraction Presence central inferior steepen Pentacam map . Axial topography consistent keratoconus Steepest keratometry ( Kmax ) value ≥ 47.00 D Inclusion criterion ectasia Prospective subject must meet following criterion : History undergone keratorefractive procedure Meeting two follow criterion Steepening topography , either Pentacam Humphrey Thinning cornea Shift position thin portion cornea Change refraction increase myopia Development myopic astigmatism Development irregular astigmatism Loss best spectacle correct acuity . 6.2 Exclusion Criteria Subjects meeting follow criterion exclude protocol : Eyes classify either normal , atypical normal , Corneal pachymetry ≤ 350 micron thinnest point measure Pentacam eye treat A history chemical injury delay epithelial heal eye treat . Pregnancy ( include plan become pregnant ) lactation course study A known sensitivity study medication Patients nystagmus condition would prevent steady gaze treatment Inability cooperate diagnostic test . Patients current condition , investigator 's opinion , would interfere prolong epithelial healing . Taking Vitamin C ( ascorbic acid ) supplement within 1 week crosslinking treatment . Patients unable remain supine tolerate lid speculum extend period time .
